Package chinesecheckers.util

Class Move

java.lang.Object
chinesecheckers.util.Move
public class Move extends Object
Represents a move from an origin virtual position to a destination virtual position. A move is a single step to a neighbor position or a chain of hops, each over one piece.
See Also:
  • VirtualPosition

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Move(VirtualPosition origin, VirtualPosition destination, Piece piece)
    Creates an object representing a move originating at origin and arriving at destination the path between the origin and destinations is omitted in this constructor.
    Move(VirtualPosition origin, VirtualPosition destination, Piece piece, List<VirtualPosition> moveChain)
    Creates an object representing a move originating at origin, arriving at destination while passing through a list of positions specified at moveChain.

  • Constructor Details

    • Move

      public Move(VirtualPosition origin, VirtualPosition destination, Piece piece, List<VirtualPosition> moveChain)
      Creates an object representing a move originating at origin, arriving at destination while passing through a list of positions specified at moveChain.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin position
      destination - the destination position
      piece - the piece that moves
      moveChain - the chain of moves which starts at origin and terminates at destination
      See Also:
      • VirtualPosition
      • Piece

      destination - the destination position
      piece - the piece that moves

  • Method Details

    • getMoveChain

      public List<VirtualPosition> getMoveChain()
      Gets the move chain originating at this origin and terminating at this destination. The move chain is a list of VirtualPosition objects starting at this origin and terminating at this destination.
      Returns:
      the move chain of this move

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece()
      Gets the Piece associated with this move.
      Returns:
      the piece associated with this move
